title: Strengthening e-Learning Practical Skills: Multidisciplinary Science-Integrated Project-Based Curriculum Design

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational science theories, research methodology comprehension, and job-related specialized knowledge
context.additional_context: Instructional design competency enhancement program for professionals in education/teaching/learning fields

learning_goals: Learners select at least three core theories from physics, chemistry, and biology, propose two or more solutions applicable to real industrial problems (e.g., energy efficiency, new material development, environmental pollution resolution), and write a report that meets at least 70% of the training institution’s evaluation rubric (validity, creativity, feasibility).

Learners apply instructional design theories such as the ADDIE model to design three or more interdisciplinary learning modules (each containing five or more learning activities) and submit a process mapping document achieving over 80% suitability in expert review.
Learners enhance collaboration and communication skills in the scientific problem-solving process through project-based activities.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
